article_title: Talks Lift Hopes of Small Argentine Bondholders
article_text:
BUENOS AIRES—Norma Lavorato worked and saved for decades, but has spent most of her twilight years waiting for the Argentine government to pay back the $45,000 she invested in sovereign bonds and lost in Argentina's massive 2001 default.

"I've had patience, a lot of patience," said Ms. Lavorato, a spry 85-year-old who turned down the small settlement offers the government made to other bondholders. "I worked for 43...

twitter.description: As an Argentine delegation is set to arrive in New York on Monday to meet with a mediator in its dispute with holdout bondholders, also at stake are the smaller claims of individual investors, including some from Argentina itself.
twitter.title: Talks Lift Hopes of Small Argentine Bondholders

image.alt: Talks Lift Hopes of Small Argentine Bondholders
